word_mean: 仪式：精神病学中，指为缓解焦虑而强迫进行的一系列重复动作，例如在强迫性神经官能症中所见者

sentence.Network_en: What we see at Westminster is a tired old ritual.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们在威斯敏斯特教堂看到的是一种经年不变的古旧仪式。

sentence.Network_en: These ceremonies were already part of pre-Christian ritual in Mexico.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些仪式已经成为墨西哥基督教时期以前的宗教仪式的一部分。

sentence.Network_en: Cocktails at the Plaza was a nightly ritual of their sophisticated world.
sentence.Network_cn: 到广场饭店喝鸡尾酒是他们这个高雅时髦的圈子中的人每晚必做的事情。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (as an adjective): from Latin ritualis, from ritus (see rite)

entry.def: A ritual is a religious service or other ceremony which involves a series of actions performed in a fixed order.

example.ex: This is the most ancient, and holiest of the Shinto rituals...
example.tran: 这是最古老、最神圣的神道教仪式。

example.ex: These ceremonies were already part of pre-Christian ritual in Mexico.
example.tran: 这些仪式已经成为墨西哥基督教时期以前的宗教仪式的一部分。

entry.def: Ritual activities happen as part of a ritual or tradition.
A ritual is a way of behaving or a series of actions which people regularly carry out in a particular situation, because it is their custom to do so.

example.ex: The whole Italian culture revolves around the ritual of eating...
example.tran: 整个意大利的文化都以饮食习惯为中心。

example.ex: Cocktails at the Plaza was a nightly ritual of their sophisticated world.
example.tran: 到广场饭店喝鸡尾酒是他们这个高雅时髦的圈子中的人每晚必做的事情。

entry.tran: 例行公事般的;习惯性的;老规矩的
entry.def: You can describe something as a ritual action when it is done in exactly the same way whenever a particular situation occurs.

example.ex: I realized that here the conventions required me to make the ritual noises.
example.tran: 我意识到此时按照惯例我应该说些客套话。

means.word_mean: 2. the prescribed procedure for conducting religious ceremonies
1. of or relating to or characteristic of religious rituals;
2. of or relating to or employed in social rites or rituals;

sentences.sentence: "sedate little colonial tribe with its ritual tea parties"- Nadine Gordimer

auth_sentence.content: Residents paid a rabbi to bury damaged ritual objects.

auth_sentence.content: He apparently found comfort in the ritual of writing.
auth_sentence.res_content: He apparently found comfort in the ritual of writing.

auth_sentence.content: Money is only an extreme and specialised type of ritual.
auth_sentence.res_content: Money is only an extreme and specialised type of ritual.

sentences.en: Many of the tribe's customs and rituals are as old as the hills.
sentences.cn: 这部落的许多风俗、仪式都极其古老。

jushi.english: Many of the tribe's rituals are as old as the hills.
jushi.chinese: 这部落的许多仪式都极其古老。

jushi.english: Smoking after dinner is becoming his ritual.
jushi.chinese: 饭后吸烟已成了他的习惯。

jushi.english: I didn't understand the ritual dance.
jushi.chinese: 我看不懂仪式上的舞蹈。
